measured_by: 7-point Inclusion of Other in the Self scale
justification: Participants were presented with a group of 20 individuals … and had to indicate how strongly they identified with both groups, using the 7-point "Inclusion of Other in the Self" scale (Aron et al., 1992).

Participants first rated their prediction … and then indicated their associated level of confidence using an 11-point scale (1 = not at all confident to 11 = completely confident); the initial confidence level was used as a measure of the uncertainty in their predictions.

measured_by: Gambling Task (number of previous decisions revealed)
justification: In the Gambling Task … participants could search the decisions of up to 20 previous in- or outgroup participants by clicking on the grey boxes, allowing measurement of whether they initiated search and how many boxes they opened.

measured_by: Election Prediction Task (number of prior choices sampled)
justification: During the Election Prediction Task, participants could then sample up to 20 decisions made by other participants on the same trial, making it possible to record if they started a search and the amount of social information they accessed.

measured_by: Relative adjustment index s in Election Prediction Task
justification: Social information use (s) was calculated as the relative adjustment from the first to the second prediction per state (s = [E2 – E1]/[X – E1]), quantifying the weight participants assigned to social information.
